ygData.subject: Some thoughts about EC and natural evolution
ygData.msgSnippet: As I wrote that answer, I started thinking on how to create unguided evolution in computers based on the principles of NEAT. This is a very complex problem.

As I wrote that answer, I started thinking on how to create unguided 
evolu=
tion in computers based on the principles of NEAT. This is a 
very complex =
problem. The problem is not that every GA is evolving to 
a predefined targ=
et and easily skips promising genomes. The problem 
is the difference betwe=
en the GAs and nature. In nature, there is no 
somebody like God who says "=
You're good and you deserve to mate, and 
you will die". The organisms are =
choosing their mates. So, a very 
good genome will not survive just because=
 its phenotype can eat a lot 
or live longer.. In fact, the phenotypes them=
selves tell which is 
good, very indirectly. This kind of indirection need =
to be 
abstracted. If we want to achieve a lot of complexity that was never=
 
discovered by humans, we have to give the individuals the power of... 
Sa=
y, it's like democracy in human society. 
What I see in Picbreeder and IEC =
at all, is that the human takes the 
role of each indivudual, when he sees =
one. As I run my view through 
these 15 images, for each one I am thinking =
of the image as it was 
me. I say "I'm looking fine!", or "Oh, I'm so ugly!=
". 
So, the way to automate this kind of process is to find a way to let 
t=
he individuals express themselves. The human designer sets up the 
environm=
ent, of course, but everything else should happen 
automatically. The selec=
tion method must be very very different than 
the usual, I guess. 
How we c=
an put this into something practical? I have some 
suggestions, but it turn=
s out to be a kind of Alife stuff. Well, I 
cannot even express myself! :) =

Does somebody have any ideas? 

Peter
